pullRequest.body:
Give `smul` versions of some existing `mul` lemmas:

- `invOf_smul_smul`
- smul_invOf_smul (c.f. mul_invOf_self_assoc)
- `invOf_smul_eq_iff` (c.f. `invOf_mul_eq_iff_eq_mul_left`) (required for #7569)
- `smul_eq_iff_eq_invOf_smul` (c.f `mul_left_eq_iff_eq_invOf_mul`)

---

[Zulip Discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/smul.20by.20invertible.20element.2E)

nodes.body: :v: mans0954 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7680741098/job/20933140598)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7680741098/job/20933140683)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7680741098/job/20933140749)
I'm pretty sure we already have this instance in another file? It's _maybe_ ok to move it here, but we shouldn't have two copies of it
Yes, with the imports I subsequently added, that now appears to be available, so I have removed this instance.
I don't think we should should make `Inverible` copies of lemmas which don't actually mention `invOf`
I've removed these lemmas, since I don't need them, although I'm not sure if your objection is to the lemmas or the way they are named?
We should keep this one; my claim was just that we should only have the ones which mention `` in the statement, which this does.
`c` and `x` should be explicit for these lemmas.
Okay, done. Please can you explain why though so I know for next time.

The simple answer here is that this lemma is almost identical to `smul_inv_smul`, and so you should try to match the argument explicitness too.

The slightly more general answer is that lemmas with `=` in their goal should ensure that every variable in their goal is captured in an an explicit variable (either as `(x : X)` or `{x : X} (hx : P x)`).

You shouldn't need to import both, since `Basic` imports `Defs`.
Also, how many files do these two `import`s add to the closure? If many, then it may be better to create a new file (e.g., `Mathlib.Algebra.Invertible.MulAction`).

If I'm counting this correctly, `Mathlib/GroupTheory/GroupAction/Group.lean` on `master` currently has `224` dependencies in Mathlib, and `1038` dependencies if you also include packages and the Lean toolchain.

In contrast, `Mathlib/GroupTheory/GroupAction/Group.lean` on this branch has `232` dependencies in Mathlib, and `1046` dependencies if you also include packages and the Lean toolchain.

This doesn't seem like many to me, so I'll proceed to merge this PR in its current form.

Maybe easier to read as
```suggestion
variable (c : ) (x y : ) [Invertible c]

@[simp]
theorem invOf_smul_smul : c  c  x = x := inv_smul_smul (unitOfInvertible c) _

@[simp]
theorem smul_invOf_smul : c  ( c  x) = x := smul_inv_smul (unitOfInvertible c) _

variable {c x y}

theorem invOf_smul_eq_iff : c  x = y  x = c  y :=
```
though it doesn't really matter.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(GroupTheory/GroupAction/Group): invOf smul lemmas
